translated: At the end of the recitation, the vighnas will be destroyed.

original: rtag tu bzlas pas kyang nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu bzlas pas kyang nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it constantly, one will become free from disease.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba dang / ring du 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba dang / ring du 'tsho bar byed do //

original: bde ba'ang so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: bde ba'ang so sor rnyed do //

original: srad bus bdag nyid srung zhing phyir zlog pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: srad bus bdag nyid srung zhing phyir zlog pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //

original: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya nyid ni sgrol ma thams cad kyi spyi'i rtsa ba'i phyag rgya ste de nyid ni sdigs mdzub bcings nas 'khyil ba'i rnam par bya ste mthe bong @349a *//

analyzed: zung yang kun tu btsir ba ni gos dkar mo'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: 'di yang phyag rgya'i sgrub thabs kyi rig pa mnyam par 'gro ma gdon mi za ba ste dang por zhabs la phyag byas te de nas las thams cad bya'o //

original: yang rtog pa'i rgyal po'i dbang po chen po 'dir 'phags ma sgrol ma dang / sgrol ma thams cad kyi sgrub pa mngon par mdzes pa thams cad dang / srung ba dang / nyes pa byas pa thams cad zlog par byed pa /

analyzed: rtog pa gzhan gyis chogs kyang ngo //🔽gang 'dod pa de dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽yang na nye bar 'joms par byed par 'gyur ro //🔽mdor na gang 'dod pa de sgrub par byed do //🔽de nas sems dpa' chen po de thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor la gzigs nas bsam pa rnam par dag pas sems dpa' chen po rnams la smras pa /🔽gang rtog pa'i rgyal po 'dir sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / mchod par 'gyur ba dang / yi ger 'dri bar 'gyur ba de rnams don thams cad kyi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should also perform the rite of assault with another mantra, namely:

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la kun nas dga' ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la kun nas dga' ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will have a loving mind toward all sentient beings, and he will be full of joy toward all sentient beings.

original: srung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srung bar byed par 'gyur ro //

original: gang du rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba mchod rten du 'gyur ba dang / sa phyogs de gang nyid kyis lag mthil du phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba mchod rten du 'gyur ba dang / sa phyogs de gang nyid kyis lag mthil du phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever this king of manuals is, that place will be like a stūpa, and that very place will be like the palm of one’s hand.

original: mchod pa 'di lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: mchod pa 'di lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: This worship is for the noble sons and daughters in the world with its gods.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thob pa des thams cad du rnal 'byor du bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thob pa des thams cad du rnal 'byor du bya'o //
translated: Whoever obtains this Dharma discourse should practice it everywhere.

original: sems can thams cad kyi stobs dang / stobs med pa shes nas rab tu gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi stobs dang / stobs med pa shes nas rab tu gsal bar bya'o //
translated: Having understood the strength and weakness of all sentient beings, he should make it clear.

original: @350a *// 'di'ang gtsang ma'i phyogs su thams cad kyis rab tu spyod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: @350a *// 'di'ang gtsang ma'i phyogs su thams cad kyis rab tu spyod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: This should be practiced by everyone in a clean place.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It should not be done elsewhere.

original: gang zhig byed pa de mngon par 'dod pa med pa sems can gyi bsam pa spang ba dang / chos dang / chos smra ba po la ma gus pa la mi 'jug pa'i rab tu sbyor bas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa de mngon par 'dod pa med pa sems can gyi bsam pa spang ba dang / chos dang / chos smra ba po la ma gus pa la mi 'jug pa'i rab tu sbyor bas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply oneself to this with a mind free of desire for any reward, and without disrespect for the intentions of sentient beings, the Dharma, or the Dharma teacher.

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'dir sgrub pa po thams cad kyis srung ba'i don du rtag ma dang / lhag ma med pa'ang rung ste gtsang sbra byas pas srung ba'i don du rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags su 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'dir sgrub pa po thams cad kyis srung ba'i don du rtag ma dang / lhag ma med pa'ang rung ste gtsang sbra byas pas srung ba'i don du rig pa'i rgyal po'i sngags su 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Here, in order to protect all practitioners, the king of knowledge mantras for the purpose of protection, whether for oneself or others, is recited with purity, without remainder.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya; na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva ra ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya; na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva ra ya /
translated: Namas ratnatrayāya, nama āryāvalokiteśvarāya,

original: bo dhi satv'a ya /
analyzed: bo dhi satv'a ya /
translated: bodhisattvāya,

original: mah'a satv'a ya /
analyzed: mah'a satv'a ya /
translated: mahāsattvāya,

original: aom aa mri ta aud bha ba h'um phat sv'ah'a //
analyzed: aom aa mri ta aud bha ba h'um phat sv'ah'a //
translated: om amṛtodbhava hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: 'di ni rta mgrin zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal po ste thal ba la lan bdun mngon par sngags pas bdag nyid srung ba dang / g-yog srung ba la mdud pa'i spyod pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rta mgrin zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal po ste thal ba la lan bdun mngon par sngags pas bdag nyid srung ba dang / g-yog srung ba la mdud pa'i spyod pa bya'o //
translated: This is the king of knowledge mantras called Hayagrīva. By incanting ashes with it seven times, one should perform the practice of tying it on oneself for protection and on one's followers for protection.

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'ang rgyal lam /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'ang rgyal lam /
translated: This king of spells, too, is victorious,

original: tha skar yang rung ste dge ba'i sbyor pa la mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho gas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas chos dang / chos yang dag par sdud pa po la'ang bsod snyoms dang / theg pa chen po la bza' ba gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: tha skar yang rung ste dge ba'i sbyor pa la mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho gas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas chos dang / chos yang dag par sdud pa po la'ang bsod snyoms dang / theg pa chen po la bza' ba gya nom pa dang /
translated: whether it is the constellation Puṣya or Āśleṣā. Having made a vast offering of worship and a sacrificial offering to the virtuous application, and also to the Dharma and the compilers of the Dharma, and having made a fine sacrificial offering to the Mahāyāna,

original: khyad par du yon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du yon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: in particular, together with a gift.

original: de nas 'di rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Then this should be completed.

original: de bzhin du bya ste rtog pa'i rgyal po ji lta ba bzhin du rtog ba'i rgyal po'i rig pa'i gsang sngags bklag @350b par bya ste de bzhin du dman par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya ste rtog pa'i rgyal po ji lta ba bzhin du rtog ba'i rgyal po'i rig pa'i gsang sngags bklag @350b par bya ste de bzhin du dman par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It should be done like this. Just as the king of spells, so the secret mantra of the king of spells should be recited. In that way, it will not be inferior.

original: ji ltar myur du dngos grub nyid kyang stsol bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar myur du dngos grub nyid kyang stsol bar byed do //
translated: It will also quickly bestow spiritual power.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga'o //
translated: The world with its gods rejoiced in what the Blessed One had said.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che shin tu rgyas pa chen po nyid kyi rtog pa'i rgyal por ral pa gyen bdzes zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das 'phags ma sgrol ma'i rtog pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che shin tu rgyas pa chen po nyid kyi rtog pa'i rgyal por ral pa gyen bdzes zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das 'phags ma sgrol ma'i rtog pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The great extensive bodhisattva canon, the king of tantras called Uṣṇīṣa-cūḍa, the conception of the Blessed Noble Tārā is complete.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ri'i rgyal po gru 'dzin na bzhugs te der bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bos te 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ri'i rgyal po gru 'dzin na bzhugs te der bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bos te 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One was dwelling on the king of mountains, Potala. There the Blessed One addressed the noble bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara and said this:

original: sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po /
translated: Great being,

original: khyod kyis ral pa gyen bdzes kyi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po de bshad do //
analyzed: khyod kyis ral pa gyen bdzes kyi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po de bshad do //
translated: you have explained the great king of tantras called Uṣṇīṣa-cūḍa.

original: da ni phyi ma'i rgyud gsang ba de gsang chen phyi ma dang bcas pa thabs sla ba /
analyzed: da ni phyi ma'i rgyud gsang ba de gsang chen phyi ma dang bcas pa thabs sla ba /
translated: Now, the latter tantra, the Secret, along with the Great Secret, is the easy method,

original: bde blag tu sgrub pa /
analyzed: bde blag tu sgrub pa /
translated: the easy accomplishment,

original: cho ga dang bcas pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod pa /
analyzed: cho ga dang bcas pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod pa /
translated: preceded by the ritual.

original: snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po bde ba'i ched dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa rnams la snying brtse ba'i ched dang / sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su yi rang bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po bde ba'i ched dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa rnams la snying brtse ba'i ched dang / sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su yi rang bar mdzad pa /
translated: It is for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the multitude, for the benefit, the welfare, and the happiness of devas and humans.

original: sgrol ma thams cad kyi thun mod pa'i rig pa /
analyzed: sgrol ma thams cad kyi thun mod pa'i rig pa /
translated: It is the knowledge of all Tārās,🔽the Uṣṇīṣavijayā,🔽the Cundā,🔽the Mahāmāyūrī,🔽the Mahāmantrānusāriṇī,🔽the Mahāpratisarā,

original: ral pa gyen brdzes @351a *//🔽rtog pa'i rgyal po nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams shod cig /
analyzed: ral pa gyen brdzes @351a *// rtog pa'i rgyal po nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams shod cig /
translated: and the Ugra.

original: bcom ldan 'das la sems dpa' chen pos 'di skad ces gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems dpa' chen pos 'di skad ces gsol te /
translated: The great being said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan rnams kyis kyang rjes su yi rang bar mdzad na bshad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan rnams kyis kyang rjes su yi rang bar mdzad na bshad par bgyi'o //
translated: If the Tathāgata approves and the other Blessed Buddhas rejoice, I will explain.

original: dang po kho nar sgrub pa pos re zhig skyabs gsum yongs su bzung ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / ral pa gyen brdzes su ji skad gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor mthong zhing dam tshig dang / slob dpon gyis rjes su gnang ba dang /
analyzed: dang po kho nar sgrub pa pos re zhig skyabs gsum yongs su bzung ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / ral pa gyen brdzes su ji skad gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor mthong zhing dam tshig dang / slob dpon gyis rjes su gnang ba dang /
translated: First, the practitioner should take refuge in the Three Jewels, generate the mind of awakening, see the maṇḍala as described in the Jaṭāmukha, and receive the commitments and the master’s permission.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs dang / mngon par dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs dang / mngon par dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba /
translated: Having been initiated with the means of accomplishment and the consecration,

original: bla ma la yon phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du rig pa blangs te ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
analyzed: bla ma la yon phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du rig pa blangs te ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
translated: having offered a gift to the guru, having taken up the knowledge in the maṇḍala, in front of the painting,

original: sku gzugs kyi drung du slar yang sgrol ma gang yang rung ba'i rig pa blang bar byas nas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi drung du slar yang sgrol ma gang yang rung ba'i rig pa blang bar byas nas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: or in front of the image, one should again take up the knowledge of any Tārā, and beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: dus phyis mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas zla ba nya la sku gzugs sam /🔽ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas 'o ma can gyi yam shing gi me sbar nas seng ldeng ngam /
analyzed: dus phyis mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas zla ba nya la sku gzugs sam / ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas 'o ma can gyi yam shing gi me sbar nas seng ldeng ngam /
translated: Later, at night, having fasted for three nights, on the full moon day, in front of the image or the painting, having performed the rite of the offering and the bali, having lit a fire of sticks of the milk trees, one should offer into the fire sticks of cutch tree or black aloe wood, six fingerbreadths long, in the number of eight thousand.

original: aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor drug pa'i tshad kyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad @351b bya'o; ;nam langs khar mtshan mo mchod pa ches rgya chen po dang / gtor ma'i cho ga ji ltar 'byor pa byas nas slong mo'i zas zos nas dngos grub stsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor drug pa'i tshad kyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad @351b bya'o; ;nam langs khar mtshan mo mchod pa ches rgya chen po dang / gtor ma'i cho ga ji ltar 'byor pa byas nas slong mo'i zas zos nas dngos grub stsal bar bya'o //
translated: At dawn, having performed a very extensive night offering and the rite of the bali as much as one can afford, having eaten the food of the mendicant, one should request the bestowal of power.

original: de nas rig pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the knowledge will be accomplished.

original: de nas las thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las thams cad bya'o //
translated: Then, one should perform all the rites.

original: yang 'dir mchog tu gsang ba'i sgrub pa'i cho ga gzhan 'byung ste bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po mthong nas dkyil 'khor de nyid du dam tshig dang / me'i bya ba gnas par ji srid gsungs pa'i cho gas rig pa sgrub par 'dod pas sgrub thabs kyi cho ga rig pa rnam par gsang ba'i ji skad gsungs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan gsum bri ste bla ma la yon rab tu phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su🔽rig pa blangs nas 'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas dang por re zhig tu di'i tshad kyi gser gyi phye ma la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'dir mchog tu gsang ba'i sgrub pa'i cho ga gzhan 'byung ste bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po mthong nas dkyil 'khor de nyid du dam tshig dang / me'i bya ba gnas par ji srid gsungs pa'i cho gas rig pa sgrub par 'dod pas sgrub thabs kyi cho ga rig pa rnam par gsang ba'i ji skad gsungs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan gsum bri ste bla ma la yon rab tu phul nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rig pa blangs nas 'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas dang por re zhig tu di'i tshad kyi gser gyi phye ma la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Having offered a great gift to the guru, one should take up the awareness in the center of the maṇḍala.🔽Having ignited a fire with sticks of a milk tree, one should first perform a burnt offering of eight hundred times of gold dust the size of a sesame seed mixed with ghee.

original: de nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing mtho gang tsam gyi tshad dang // mar rnams kyi sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing mtho gang tsam gyi tshad dang // mar rnams kyi sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Then, one should perform a burnt offering of eight hundred times of sticks of black agarwood the size of a cubit and ghee.

original: tsandan dkar po'i yam shing la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //🔽de nas slar yang gser gyi phye ma la bar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dkar po'i yam shing la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o // de nas slar yang gser gyi phye ma la bar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of sticks of white sandalwood smeared with ghee.🔽Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of gold dust smeared with honey.

original: de nas dngul gyi phye ma la sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //🔽de nas ra gan gyi phye ma la 'o mas @352a *//🔽btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //🔽de nas zangs kyi phye ma la zhos btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dngul gyi phye ma la sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o // de nas ra gan gyi phye ma la 'o mas @352a *// btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o // de nas zangs kyi phye ma la zhos btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of silver dust smeared with honey.🔽Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of brass dust smeared with milk.🔽Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of copper dust smeared with curd.

original: de nas mu tig gi 'bras bu'i phye mas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //🔽de nas tsandan dmar po'i phye mas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mu tig gi 'bras bu'i phye mas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o // de nas tsandan dmar po'i phye mas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of pearl powder.🔽Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of red sandalwood powder.

original: de nas tsandan dmar po'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tsandan dmar po'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of sticks of red sandalwood smeared with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: de nas 'bru dang / bza' ba dang / longs spyod la sogs pa thams cad kyi sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'bru dang / bza' ba dang / longs spyod la sogs pa thams cad kyi sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of grain, food, and enjoyments.🔽Then, having washed a white flower, one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of the flower, reciting the mantra once for each oblation.

original: de nas dkar por rnam par brtag pa legs par bkrus shing dri zhim po'i gos skra dang bral ba'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;re re la lan re yongs su bzlas nas de nas gu gul dang / shri b'a sa dang / gandha ras dang /
analyzed: de nas dkar por rnam par brtag pa legs par bkrus shing dri zhim po'i gos skra dang bral ba'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;re re la lan re yongs su bzlas nas de nas gu gul dang / shri b'a sa dang / gandha ras dang /
translated: Then, having mixed together agalloch, śrīvasa, gandharasa,

original: kun du ru ska dang / ga bur rnams gcig tu byas nas mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun du ru ska dang / ga bur rnams gcig tu byas nas mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun dbul bar bya'o //
translated: kumkuma, and camphor, one should offer seven oblations of it mixed with ghee.

original: de nas ji ltar rnyed ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams kyis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar rnyed ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams kyis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of whatever fruits, and so forth, one has obtained.

original: de nas dri bzang po'i me tog rnams kyis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dri bzang po'i me tog rnams kyis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of fragrant flowers.

original: de nas bza' ba mchog gi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bza' ba mchog gi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of the best food.

original: de nas gzhon nu @352b mas bkal ba'i skud pa cha dang bcas par byas pa la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu @352b mas bkal ba'i skud pa cha dang bcas par byas pa la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblations of ghee on the thread spun by a young girl, together with the warp.

original: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog gis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas mar gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog gis sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas mar gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should make seven oblations with karavīra flowers.🔽Then, one should make seven oblations of ghee.

original: de nas thal ba'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thal ba'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblation of ashes.

original: de nas sdong bu can 'bras bu med pa rnams la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sdong bu can 'bras bu med pa rnams la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblations of ghee on the fruit-bearing trees.

original: de nas mar sar gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas gser gyi phye ma'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mar sar gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas gser gyi phye ma'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblations of ghee and molasses.🔽Then, one should make seven oblations of gold dust.

original: de nas dar ba'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dar ba'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblations of silk.

original: de nas yung ba'i phye ma la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yung ba'i phye ma la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make seven oblations of red arsenic mixed with ghee.

original: de nas rgyam tshva dang / lan tshva la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyam tshva dang / lan tshva la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of ghee mixed with salt and black mustard.

original: de nas bu ram gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas sra rtsi pog gi phye ma'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas lcags kyi phye ma mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bu ram gyi sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas sra rtsi pog gi phye ma'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas lcags kyi phye ma mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of molasses.🔽Then one should offer seven oblations of camphor powder.🔽Then one should offer seven oblations of iron powder mixed with ghee.

original: de nas sa lam lhung pa'i ba lang gi lci ba la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas bil ba'i 'bras @353a *//
analyzed: de nas sa lam lhung pa'i ba lang gi lci ba la mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas bil ba'i 'bras @353a *//
translated: Then one should offer seven oblations of cow dung fallen on the ground mixed with ghee.🔽Then one should offer seven oblations of bilva fruit

original: bu la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bu la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: mixed with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: de nas ti la nag po dang / 'bras yos lhan cig pa la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa rnams dang / gser dang / dngul gyi phye ma phan tshun bsres pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;bar skabs 'dir sgrub pa po lha thams cad kyis kun tu gzigs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas ti la nag po dang / 'bras yos lhan cig pa la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa rnams dang / gser dang / dngul gyi phye ma phan tshun bsres pa'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;bar skabs 'dir sgrub pa po lha thams cad kyis kun tu gzigs par byed do //
translated: At this juncture, the adept is seen by all the gods.

original: de dang / 'di'ang bdag gi mchog tu gsang chen gyi gsang ba'i sgrub pa nye bar spyad pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de dang / 'di'ang bdag gi mchog tu gsang chen gyi gsang ba'i sgrub pa nye bar spyad pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is also my supreme secret practice of the secret practice of the great secret.

original: de langs nas dkyil 'khor la bskor bar byas te sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag btsal nas bla ma la yon gyi mchog phul te gang gis sam /
analyzed: de langs nas dkyil 'khor la bskor bar byas te sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag btsal nas bla ma la yon gyi mchog phul te gang gis sam /
translated: Having risen, one should circumambulate the maṇḍala, pay homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and offer the guru the best of one’s possessions.

original: de'i thad kar yang rung ste zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thad kar yang rung ste zhu bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in front of him or her, one should request the practice.

original: dkyil 'khor bris par lha rnams mthong nas bla ma la phyag btsal te mngon par dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rjes su gnang ba'ang zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bris par lha rnams mthong nas bla ma la phyag btsal te mngon par dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rjes su gnang ba'ang zhu bar bya'o //
translated: Having seen the deities in the maṇḍala, one should bow to the guru and request the bestowal of the abhiṣeka and the permission to practice for the sake of siddhi.

original: de nas las grub pa'i cho ga 'dis mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal bas kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas las grub pa'i cho ga 'dis mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal bas kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by this rite of accomplishing the activity, even one who is extremely immoral will accomplish the Blessed Lady.

original: sgrub thabs kyi nye bar spyod pa'i cho ga 'di mchog tu gsang ba shin tu gsang chen te /
analyzed: sgrub thabs kyi nye bar spyod pa'i cho ga 'di mchog tu gsang ba shin tu gsang chen te /
translated: This rite of the practice of the means of achievement is supremely secret, a great secret.

original: mdor na las @353b gang yang ci yin pa 'dis byed pa'ang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na las @353b gang yang ci yin pa 'dis byed pa'ang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, whatever activity one performs with it, one will succeed.

original: de'i thams cad zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can dang / mngon par mdzes pa'i las rnams ni ji lta ji ltar sgrub par byed pa de lta de ltar sgrub pa nye bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i thams cad zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can dang / mngon par mdzes pa'i las rnams ni ji lta ji ltar sgrub par byed pa de lta de ltar sgrub pa nye bar 'gro'o //
translated: All his activities, whether pacifying, enriching, or powerfully attractive, will be successful just as he performs them.

original: de ltar yang rig pa rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar legs par rab tu sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang rig pa rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar legs par rab tu sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And so, whatever the application of the knowledge, it will be applied well.

original: ji ltar yang sgrub par byed pa de ltar sgrub par byed de las de dang / 'di rig pa thams cad dga' ba zhes pa de dang / 'dis las rnams mchog tu sgrub pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang sgrub par byed pa de ltar sgrub par byed de las de dang / 'di rig pa thams cad dga' ba zhes pa de dang / 'dis las rnams mchog tu sgrub pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: One should know that this rite of all the vidyās is delightful, and that by this rite the supreme siddhis are born.

original: mdor na bdag gi seng+ge'i sgra 'di gang la la rig pa la dga' ba 'dis las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na bdag gi seng+ge'i sgra 'di gang la la rig pa la dga' ba 'dis las byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, this lion’s roar of mine: whoever delights in the vidyā will perform the rite by this.

original: de dang / 'di kho na'i lag mthil du dngos grub so sor gnas par rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang / 'di kho na'i lag mthil du dngos grub so sor gnas par rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the siddhis are individually present in the palm of his and her hand.

original: las 'di'ang gso sbyong can gyi sngon 'das pa byas pa dag 'phags pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: las 'di'ang gso sbyong can gyi sngon 'das pa byas pa dag 'phags pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This rite should be understood by those who have previously performed the purification and restraint, just as the noble ones do.

original: gsang ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The secret rite of service.

original: sgrub thabs gzhan gyi cho ga ni rgya mtsho'i 'gram du song nas bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad mchod rten stong phrag brgyad byas nas re re'i spyan sdar dri dang / me tog la sogs pa phul te stong phrag brgyad du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub thabs gzhan gyi cho ga ni rgya mtsho'i 'gram du song nas bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad mchod rten stong phrag brgyad byas nas re re'i spyan sdar dri dang / me tog la sogs pa phul te stong phrag brgyad du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Another rite: having gone to the ocean shore, one should build eight thousand stūpas of the Sugata, each one cubit in size, and offer to each of them incense, flowers, and so forth, and recite the mantra eight thousand times.

original: rdzogs pa'i dus su'ang slong mo bza' bar bya ste yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dus su'ang slong mo bza' bar bya ste yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of completion, one should eat alms-food and offer a gift.

original: de nas rig par grub par 'gyur ro //🔽cho ga gzhan ni chu bo'i @354a *//
analyzed: de nas rig par grub par 'gyur ro // cho ga gzhan ni chu bo'i @354a *//
translated: Then one will become a vidyādhara.

original: 'gram du cho gas 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gram du cho gas 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Another rite: on the bank of a river, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times according to the rite. One will become accomplished.

original: cho ga gzhan 'di'ang yod de ri'i rtse mor 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan 'di'ang yod de ri'i rtse mor 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Another rite: on the peak of a mountain, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times. One will become accomplished.

original: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te mar gyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te mar gyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Another rite: one should offer one hundred thousand oblations of ghee. One will become accomplished.

original: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te til nag po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te til nag po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is another rite: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of black sesame seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee. One will be successful.

original: cho ga gzhan ni aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan ni aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Another rite: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand sticks of black aloe wood. One will be successful.

original: cho ga gzhan ni me tog thams cad kyi sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan ni me tog thams cad kyi sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
translated: Another rite: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand flowers of all kinds.

original: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te thang chu thams cad kyi sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni cho ga gzhan te thang chu thams cad kyi sbyin sreg 'bum bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is another rite: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of all kinds of exudations. One will be successful.

original: cho ga gzhan ni mchod rten chen po rnams la mngon par phyag 'tshal zhing 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan ni mchod rten chen po rnams la mngon par phyag 'tshal zhing 'bum bzlas par bya ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Another rite: One should pay homage to the great stūpas and recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times. One will be successful.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i thabs 'di rnams ni de nas las su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i thabs 'di rnams ni de nas las su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, these methods of practice will be successful.

original: dran pa tsam gyis bdag nyid srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis bdag nyid srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely remembering [the mantra], one will protect oneself.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhi bar byed do //
translated: By merely reciting [the mantra], one will pacify [afflictions].

original: yungs gar dkar po'i sbyin sreg rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yungs gar dkar po'i sbyin sreg rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers white mustard seeds, one will obtain prosperity.

original: bong bu dang / rnga mo'i spangs kyis mngon spyod can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bong bu dang / rnga mo'i spangs kyis mngon spyod can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers donkey and camel dung, one will obtain the power of destruction.

original: ske tshe'i 'bru dang / me tog gi rgyal po'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yas pa nas brtsams te @354b mtshon rnon pos gtub cing gtub cing sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: ske tshe'i 'bru dang / me tog gi rgyal po'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yas pa nas brtsams te @354b mtshon rnon pos gtub cing gtub cing sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: If one makes an effigy of a human being out of mustard seeds and the flower king, and cuts it with a sharp knife, beginning with the right foot, and offers it into the fire, one will obtain the power of destruction.🔽If one offers sesame seeds and oblations of ghee into the fire for seven days, three times a day, for eight hundred times,🔽one will obtain the power of destruction.

translated: If one performs the rite for someone who has done these things, it will destroy their accomplishments in an instant. If one has recited the vidyā only a little, one will live a long time, but one will not attain the accomplishment that is to be attained at that time.

original: slar yang rig pa 'dzin pa gang zhig gsang ba'i sgrub pa'i tshogs rgyal po'i rkang rjes kyi sa la bar skabs 'dir brgyad brgya'am /

original: de nyid du thams cad du byed pa'i rgyal po ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid du thams cad du byed pa'i rgyal po ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //

original: rgyal rigs dbang du byed pa la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i yungs kar seng ldeng gi shing gi me la sbyin sreg byas na sngar bzhin dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dbang du byed pa la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i yungs kar seng ldeng gi shing gi me la sbyin sreg byas na sngar bzhin dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For enthralling a kṣatriya, one should offer oblations of mustard seeds smeared with hot oil in a fire of cutch wood, as before, until (the target) is enthralled.

original: rje rigs dbang du byed pa la 'bras s'a lu'i zan zho dang lhan cig pa aa mra'i shing gi me la sbyin sreg bya ste sngar bzhin dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rje rigs dbang du byed pa la 'bras s'a lu'i zan zho dang lhan cig pa aa mra'i shing gi me la sbyin sreg bya ste sngar bzhin dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For subjugating the warrior caste, one should offer oblations of rice gruel together with mango in a fire of mango wood; as before, [the victim] will be subjugated.

original: dman pa thams cad dbang du byed pa la tsher ma can gyi yam shing gi me sbar nas ske che dang / dug dang / nimba lhan cig pa'i sbyin sreg zla ba gcig tu ji ltar 'dod pa'i thun mtshams la brtsams nas dus gcig la stong phrag brgyad byas na de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman pa thams cad dbang du byed pa la tsher ma can gyi yam shing gi me sbar nas ske che dang / dug dang / nimba lhan cig pa'i sbyin sreg zla ba gcig tu ji ltar 'dod pa'i thun mtshams la brtsams nas dus gcig la stong phrag brgyad byas na de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For subjugating all low-caste people, one should light a fire of sticks with thorns, and offer into it oblations of mustard, poison, and neem leaves, beginning at the junction of the lunar mansions of Āśleṣā and Maghā, for one month, at the appropriate time, until one has completed one thousand oblations.

original: gzhan yang / 'dir 'byung ba ni thun mong du mchog dang / 'bring dang / tha ma sgrub pa'i las ni yungs kar dkar po stong phrag brgyad @363a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dir 'byung ba ni thun mong du mchog dang / 'bring dang / tha ma sgrub pa'i las ni yungs kar dkar po stong phrag brgyad @363a *//
translated: Moreover, it is stated here that for the rites of accomplishing the supreme, middling, and low [goals] in common, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight white mustard seeds

original: gang bstan bya'i sbyin sreg byed pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bstan bya'i sbyin sreg byed pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: for each syllable of the mantra. The one for whom the oblation is performed will be subjugated.

original: bud med dbang du byed pa la til gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med dbang du byed pa la til gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For subjugating a woman, one should offer into the fire eight thousand sesame seeds; she will be subjugated.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la yungs kar dkar po la mar dang / zho dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la yungs kar dkar po la mar dang / zho dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: On the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should offer into the fire seven oblations of white mustard seeds smeared with ghee, curd, and honey.

original: gang bstan bya nyi ma gsum la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bstan bya nyi ma gsum la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will enthrall whomever one points it at for three days.

original: gzhon nu ma dbang du byed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma dbang du byed par 'dod pas /
translated: If one wants to enthrall a young woman,🔽one should offer eight thousand ramaṇa flowers to Noble Avalokiteśvara. She will be enthralled.

original: ram ga na'i me tog stong phrag brgyad kyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa byas na dbang du 'gyur ro; ;spra tshil las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas bdag nyid kyi lag par bzhag ste stong phrag brgyad bzlas na gang bstan pa de dbang🔽du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ram ga na'i me tog stong phrag brgyad kyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa byas na dbang du 'gyur ro; ;spra tshil las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas bdag nyid kyi lag par bzhag ste stong phrag brgyad bzlas na gang bstan pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes an effigy out of beeswax, places it in one’s hand, and recites the mantra eight thousand times, one will enthrall whomever one points it at.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar me tog dkar po brgyad brgya dbul bar bya ste gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar me tog dkar po brgyad brgya dbul bar bya ste gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of the painting, one should offer eight hundred white flowers. One will enthrall whomever one points it at.

original: dung dang / gla rtsi dang / shu dag dang / gi wang dang / rgya spos rnams gcig tu byas nas btags par bya'o //
analyzed: dung dang / gla rtsi dang / shu dag dang / gi wang dang / rgya spos rnams gcig tu byas nas btags par bya'o //
translated: One should mix together conch, musk, śaṭī, costus root, and olibanum.

original: stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas 'di btungs pas sam /
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas 'di btungs pas sam /
translated: Having enchanted [them] eight thousand times, one should drink [the ashes] or give [them] to someone.

original: gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: [That] person will be enthralled.

original: bram ze mo dbang du byed pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar bil ba'i myu gu stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze mo dbang du byed pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar bil ba'i myu gu stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For enthralling a brahmin woman, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight bilva sprouts in front of the painting. [She] will be enthralled.

original: dur khrod du lan bdun bzlas pas bud med gang la skyes bu gang gis mdun du 'dug nas @363b stong phrag brgyad bzlas pa byas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du lan bdun bzlas pas bud med gang la skyes bu gang gis mdun du 'dug nas @363b stong phrag brgyad bzlas pa byas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In a charnel ground, one should recite [the mantra] seven times. Any woman in front of whom a man sits and recites [the mantra] eight thousand times will be enthralled.

original: sor mo gcig pa'i shing blangs nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags te gang dang / gang kun tu 'gugs par byed pa de dbang du 'gyur ro; ;me tog brgya pa stong phrag brgyad 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sor mo gcig pa'i shing blangs nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags te gang dang / gang kun tu 'gugs par byed pa de dbang du 'gyur ro; ;me tog brgya pa stong phrag brgyad 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Taking a single-finger tree, having enchanted [it] eight thousand times, one should summon whomever. [That] person will be enthralled. One should offer one thousand and eight hundred-petaled flowers in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'di la me tog gcig blangs nas bud med la bltas nas bskor bar bya ste 'ong bar byed cing dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la me tog gcig blangs nas bud med la bltas nas bskor bar bya ste 'ong bar byed cing dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking a single flower, one should look at the woman, circle her, and come back; she will become enthralled.

original: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhib phyogs gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhib phyogs gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should eat milk and barley meal and recite [the mantra] in one place.

original: de nas grog mkhar gyis las byung ba'i nor rgyas kyi bu byas nas de la nye bar 'dug ste ji srid g-yo bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas grog mkhar gyis las byung ba'i nor rgyas kyi bu byas nas de la nye bar 'dug ste ji srid g-yo bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a Śakra of clay from an anthill, one should sit near it and recite [the mantra] as long as it moves.

original: de lta bus grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this means, one will become accomplished.

original: nor rgyas kyi bu bdag nyid ma sha bcu gnyis kyi bza' ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: nor rgyas kyi bu bdag nyid ma sha bcu gnyis kyi bza' ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: Śakra himself will give one food for twelve months.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i don ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i don ston par byed do //
translated: He will tell one’s past, future, and present fortunes.

original: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing sku gzugs kyi mdun du stong phrag brgyad bzlas pas longs spyod so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing sku gzugs kyi mdun du stong phrag brgyad bzlas pas longs spyod so sor rnyed do //
translated: Eating milk and barley meal, one should recite [the mantra] eight thousand times in front of the image; one will obtain enjoyments.

original: zla ba gcig tu bsod snyoms bza' zhing dkar po'i bcu gcig la mtshan mo gcig tu smyung bar gnas pas sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar mchod pa chen po byas nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / sku gzugs kyi zhabs dag la 'jus nas ji srid du sku gzugs g-yo bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tu bsod snyoms bza' zhing dkar po'i bcu gcig la mtshan mo gcig tu smyung bar gnas pas sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar mchod pa chen po byas nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / sku gzugs kyi zhabs dag la 'jus nas ji srid du sku gzugs g-yo bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, holding the feet of the image of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, one should recite [the mantra] until the image moves.

original: g-yos pas gang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yos pas gang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see whatever [the image] indicates.

original: @364a *// dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @364a *// dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the king of all powers.

original: yid kyis gang skyed par byed du 'jug go /
analyzed: yid kyis gang skyed par byed du 'jug go /
translated: One can cause whatever one imagines to be produced.

original: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live for five thousand years.

original: gang g'ar'a zhugs te 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gang g'ar'a zhugs te 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should enter the Ganges and recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: phyin nas de srid du sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar bye ma las byung ba'i mchod rten byas nas sbrang rtsi dang / 'o ma gcig tu byas te sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: phyin nas de srid du sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar bye ma las byung ba'i mchod rten byas nas sbrang rtsi dang / 'o ma gcig tu byas te sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, in front of the image, one should make a sand stupa and perform a homa of honey and milk.

original: klu thams cad 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: klu thams cad 'ong bar byed do //
translated: He will cause all nāgas to come.

original: gang smras pa de thams cad byed do //
analyzed: gang smras pa de thams cad byed do //
translated: He will do whatever he is told.

original: ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas til mar gyis btags pa'i tsandan gyi zhogs ma'i sbyin sreg bya ste gnod sbyin 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas til mar gyis btags pa'i tsandan gyi zhogs ma'i sbyin sreg bya ste gnod sbyin 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “One should climb to the top of a mountain, install the painting, and offer into the fire sesame oil and white sandalwood. A yakṣa will come.

original: gang smras pa de thams cad byed do //
analyzed: gang smras pa de thams cad byed do //
translated: He will do whatever he is told.

original: nags su ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas sbrang rtsi dang; ;pi pi ling gcig tu byas pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: nags su ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas sbrang rtsi dang; ;pi pi ling gcig tu byas pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad 'ong bar byed do //
translated: “One should install the painting in a forest and offer into the fire honey and black mustard seeds combined. This will cause all vidyādharas to come.

original: bka' bsgo ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bka' bsgo ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will do whatever he is told.

original: shing gcig tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can gyi mchod rten rab tu bzhugs nas 'bum phrag bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: shing gcig tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can gyi mchod rten rab tu bzhugs nas 'bum phrag bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “One should install the painting in a solitary place and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: 'bum yongs su rdzogs pa na gso sbyong can gyis gzugs kyis rnam pas byang chub shing las byung ba rtse gsum mtshan nyid dang ldan pa byed du bcug nas stong phrag rdzogs pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste zla ba nya la dri bzang @364b pis rab tu byugs nas
analyzed: 'bum yongs su rdzogs pa na gso sbyong can gyis gzugs kyis rnam pas byang chub shing las byung ba rtse gsum mtshan nyid dang ldan pa byed du bcug nas stong phrag rdzogs pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste zla ba nya la dri bzang @364b pis rab tu byugs nas
translated: When the hundred thousand has been completed, one should make a three-pronged vajra, with the characteristics as described, from the wood of the Bodhi tree, and perform a homa of one thousand oblations. On the full moon, one should anoint it with fragrant substances,

original: ras ris la ji ltar 'byor ba'i mched pa byas nas lag pa g-yas pas blangs te mtshan thog thag tu bsgrub par bya ste ji srid 'bar gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ras ris la ji ltar 'byor ba'i mched pa byas nas lag pa g-yas pas blangs te mtshan thog thag tu bsgrub par bya ste ji srid 'bar gyi bar du'o //
translated: worship the painting with whatever articles one can procure, take it with one’s right hand, and perform the rite throughout the night until it glows.

original: 'bar bas 'byung po'i bdag po gnyis pa gdul dka' gdul ba po //
analyzed: 'bar bas 'byung po'i bdag po gnyis pa gdul dka' gdul ba po //
translated: When it glows, one becomes the second lord of spirits, the subduer of the difficult to subdue.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i lha chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i lha chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a great god, invincible to all beings.

original: rgya mtshor zhugs te 'bum bzlas so //
analyzed: rgya mtshor zhugs te 'bum bzlas so //
translated: One should enter the ocean and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i klu de mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i klu de mthong bar byed do //
translated: One will see any nāga one desires, such as the nāga king Sāgara.

original: nor bu rin po che'ang 'di la rab tu stsol lo //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'ang 'di la rab tu stsol lo //
translated: He will grant one a precious jewel.

original: de blangs pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te klu'i rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de blangs pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te klu'i rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: By taking it, one will become a vidyādhara and the king of all nāga-vidyādharas.

original: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing 'bum phrag bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing 'bum phrag bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should eat milk and barley meal and recite [the mantra] seven hundred thousand times.

original: de nas gso sbyong can gyis las byed pas zangs kyi snod byed du bcug nas cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nyal 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang bar byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar so sor bzhag ste ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gso sbyong can gyis las byed pas zangs kyi snod byed du bcug nas cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nyal 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang bar byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar so sor bzhag ste ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, one who has taken the purificatory fast should have a copper vessel made by a worker who has taken the purificatory fast. Having filled it with all kinds of grains, herbs, and jewels, one should place it in front of the painting and recite [the mantra] until it emits light.

original: de dang lag pa bcug nas gang 'dod pa de dang; de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang lag pa bcug nas gang 'dod pa de dang; de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having inserted one’s hand, whatever one desires will come forth from it.

original: snod bzang po'i sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: snod bzang po'i sgrub thabs so //
translated: This is the sādhana of the excellent vessel.

original: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having entered a river that flows into the ocean, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: phyi nas zla ba nya la nor bu'am /
analyzed: phyi nas zla ba nya la nor bu'am /
translated: Afterwards, on the full moon day, one should recite [the mantra] until a jewel, a gem, or a pearl appears.

original: sa las byung ba'i mchod rten byas te de nyid du ras ris byed du bcug nas cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang ba byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar so sor bzhag ste @365a *//
analyzed: sa las byung ba'i mchod rten byas te de nyid du ras ris byed du bcug nas cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang ba byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar so sor bzhag ste @365a *//
translated: Having made a stūpa out of clay, one should have a painting made there. On the full moon day of the month of Kārttika, having filled it with all types of grains and herbs, one should place it in front of the painting.

original: mchod pa chen po byas nas bzhag pa'i nor bu'am /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po byas nas bzhag pa'i nor bu'am /
translated: Having made a great offering, one should place the jewel that was previously placed there or the clay stūpa.

original: sa las byung ba lag pa g-yas pas blangs te skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug la ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa las byung ba lag pa g-yas pas blangs te skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug la ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having taken it with one’s right hand, one should sit in the cross-legged posture and recite the mantra until it emits light.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'chang ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'chang ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a vidyādhara possessing a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o; ;cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la mchod pa sna tshogs pa byas nas mar me'i phreng ba'am rgya cher byas te lag pa g-yas pas rgyal mtshan gos dkar po
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris rab tu bzhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o; ;cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la mchod pa sna tshogs pa byas nas mar me'i phreng ba'am rgya cher byas te lag pa g-yas pas rgyal mtshan gos dkar po
translated: “One should install the painting in a stūpa containing relics and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times. On the full moon day of the month of Kārttika, having made various offerings, one should light a garland of lamps or make a large one and, holding it in one’s right hand, one should recite the mantra until the stūpa emits light.

original: 'phyang ba bzung nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phyang ba bzung nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Holding it by the fringe, one should recite the mantra for as long as it blazes.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a vidyādhara of the banner.

original: thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gro'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gro'o //
translated: One will go everywhere without impediment.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la ras ris la mchod pa chen po byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam la dri bzang po'i dri yis so sor byugs nas dri zhim po'i me tog gi phreng ba dkris
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi zla ba nya la ras ris la mchod pa chen po byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam la dri bzang po'i dri yis so sor byugs nas dri zhim po'i me tog gi phreng ba dkris
translated: On the full moon of the miraculous lunar mansion, having performed a great pūjā before the painting, one should anoint the book of the Blessed Prajñāpāramitā with fragrant scents, wrap it in a garland of fragrant flowers,

original: te lag pa g-yon pas bzung nas skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug ste ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlos par bya'o //
analyzed: te lag pa g-yon pas bzung nas skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug ste ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlos par bya'o //
translated: and hold it with one’s left hand. Sitting in the cross-legged posture, one should recite the mantra for as long as it blazes.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a king of the vidyādharas.

original: gang du 'dod pa de ru 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa de ru 'gro bar byed do //
translated: One will go wherever one wishes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa spyod ma'i gzhon nu ma rab tu mdzes pa legs par khrus byas pa rgyan gyis brgyan par byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji ltar 'byor pa'i @365b mchod pa bya ste lag pa g-yon pas rab tu bzung ste g-yas pas ji
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa spyod ma'i gzhon nu ma rab tu mdzes pa legs par khrus byas pa rgyan gyis brgyan par byas nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji ltar 'byor pa'i @365b mchod pa bya ste lag pa g-yon pas rab tu bzung ste g-yas pas ji
translated: The maiden who is practicing the conduct of the bodhisattvas, who is very beautiful, who has bathed well, and who is adorned with ornaments, should be held with the left hand and with the right hand

original: srid de dang thabs cig tu 'bar ba 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

translated: One should eat milk and barley meal and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.🔽One should perform the preliminary practice. On the eighth or eleventh day of the dark fortnight, one should take the corpse of a man who has not been cremated, wash it, adorn it with ornaments, and dress it in the attire of a newlywed bride.🔽One should worship it with perfumes, flowers, and incense, and, pressing it with one’s left foot on one’s chest, one should recite the vidyā over and over again, striking it with a heated iron.

original: yang du rig pa bzlas te thal lcags gis bsnun par byas te langs pa de srid du'o //

analyzed: sngon spyang pa byas pa de nyid chu klung du zhugs nas sna ma'i me tog 'bum dbul bar bya'o //

analyzed: sdig pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Having made a paste of equal parts of śrīparṇī, śleṣmātaka, śaṭī, and pippalī, one should offer it into the fire together with honey, in front of Noble Mañjuśrī, reciting the mantra twenty-one times. In seven days one will become as wise as Noble Mañjuśrī.

original: zla ba gnyis kyis sbyor bas thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyis sbyor bas thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
translated: In front of a painting or

translated: in front of an image, one should recite the mantra eight thousand times and then read the text.

analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma so so la mi smra bar bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: bcings pa'am / 'gags par yang rung ste bzlas pa tsam nyid kyis grol lo //

analyzed: chom rkun la ltas nas bzlas pas chom rkun gyis mi tshugs so //

translated: In front of the blessed buddhas, one should anoint the maṇḍala, strew it with flowers, and drink water from one’s cupped hands, over which the mantra has been recited seven times.

analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //

original: sngon gyi tshig bla dvags nyams par byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshig bla dvags nyams par byed do //

analyzed: yid gzhungs par 'gyur zhing lnga brgya 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'chang ba byed cing srung ngo //

original: dug gso ba la chu gris so //
analyzed: dug gso ba la chu gris so //
translated: For the cure of poison, [use] water enchanted seven times.

analyzed: lan bdun bzlas pa'i yal 'dab kyis gdon 'joms par byed do // me tog dkar po'am /

analyzed: gu gul gyi bdug pas gdon gyis zin pa rnams la'o //

analyzed: rmugs par byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa la sogs pa'i las rnams nus par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phye za zhing chu klung gi chur zhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: dbang du byed pa dang / mi snang ba dang / ldong ros la sogs pas sgrub @377b pa rnams nus par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: klu'i gnas su karb'a ba'i btus pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //

original: gang tshol ba de rnyed do //
analyzed: gang tshol ba de rnyed do //

original: dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: til gyi sbyin bsreg gis ro ldan ma dbang du byed do //

analyzed: log par 'dren pa thams cad las grol lo //

analyzed: de blangs pas 'khor dang bcas pa skye bar 'gyur te rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lo bye ba phrag bcu gcig tu 'tsho bar byed do //

analyzed: dus la bab pa dang lha rnams su nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Having performed the rite of the great worship, one should make offerings to the noble Saṅgha according to one’s ability, and having bowed to the feet of the noble Saṅgha, one should request permission from the noble Saṅgha.

analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar yungs kar gyi phung po byas nas de la gong nas gong du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //

original: gdon 'jug pa thams cad la gu gul @378b gyi bdug pas so //
analyzed: gdon 'jug pa thams cad la gu gul @378b gyi bdug pas so //
translated: For all the afflictions of spirits, one should offer incense of guggula.

original: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed do //

original: rlung dang / sprin thams cad gnon pa la bzlas pas so //
analyzed: rlung dang / sprin thams cad gnon pa la bzlas pas so //
translated: For all winds and clouds, one should recite the mantra.

analyzed: yungs kar la bzlas nas de mnan pas nam mkhar gtor bar bya ste chu rengs so //
translated: Having enchanted mustard seeds, one should scatter them over the one who is to be suppressed, and the water will be arrested.

analyzed: seng ldeng gi phur bu la lan bdun bzlas pas sa la brko bar bya'o //

analyzed: dug thams cad dang / sngags rnams la chu la lan bdun bzlas pa sbyin sreg bya ste dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of all poisons and spells, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of enchanted water; the poison will be removed.

original: nor 'dod pa gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar kun tu ru'i bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: nor 'dod pa gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar kun tu ru'i bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One who desires wealth, pure and wearing clean clothes, should fast for one day and one night and offer aloe incense in front of the painting.

original: rmi lam du dge ba dang / mi dge ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: rmi lam du dge ba dang / mi dge ba ston par byed do //
translated: He will reveal what is virtuous and nonvirtuous in dreams.

original: stong phrag bdun bzlas pas dngul sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun bzlas pas dngul sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one recites [the mantra] seven thousand times, he will give silver.

original: thams cad dbye ba la thal bas so //🔽longs spyod don du gnyer bas chu klung 'dus ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad dbye ba la thal bas so // longs spyod don du gnyer bas chu klung 'dus ba'am /

original: lteng kar gtsang ma'i phyogs su ras ris bzhugs su gsol nas bzlas pa dang / sbyin sreg brtsam par bya'o //🔽padma la zho dang / sbrang rtsi @379a *//

translated: If one desires wealth, one should set up the painting on the bank of a river or in a lotus pond, and commence the recitation and homa.

analyzed: sa pha li ka'i me tog stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /

translated: One will become unobstructed to all gods, nāgas, and yakṣas. One will have the divine ear and the speed of thought. One will have the complexion of the rising sun and will be desired by all the vidyādharas.

analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa brgya phrag gis yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro //

translated: When there is an eclipse of the moon, one should place the sandalwood on a leaf of the seven-leaved frame tree, and in a caitya containing relics, one should perform the sādhana according to the instructions.

original: ji srid 'bar bar gyur par ro //
analyzed: ji srid 'bar bar gyur par ro //

analyzed: lo stong du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mig sman sgrub par 'dod pas so so b'i ra ma na srang gcig blangs nas mes gdungs bzang por byas nas mig sman gyi las rnams rtogs par bya ste zla ba gzas bzung ba na @384b chur rab tu zhugs nas ji srid grul bum du gyur pa de
translated: One who desires to perform the rite of eye ointment should take one pala of each of the ingredients, heat them well over a fire, and perform the rite of eye ointment.

analyzed: srid du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: de la 'dug pa dang lhan cig mngon par sngags nas gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: me tog phreng ba la yongs su bzlas nas gang gi mgo la bcings pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //

original: rgya spos dang / tu rushka dang / til rnams cha mnyam pa gcig @396a *//
analyzed: rgya spos dang / tu rushka dang / til rnams cha mnyam pa gcig @396a *//

analyzed: tu byas nas ba ser skya'i mang gyis ril bu byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should make a pill out of these with the milk of a tawny cow.

original: sngon du sgrub pa thams cad gsum par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du sgrub pa thams cad gsum par bya'o //
translated: First, one should perform all the accomplishments three times.

analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo 'khor dang bcas pa dbang du byed par 'dod pas ku sha las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas lag pa g-yon pas mnan te zlos shig /
translated: If one wishes to enthrall a king's queen together with her retinue, one should make her effigy out of kuśa grass, press it down with one's left foot, and recite the mantra.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: She will be enthralled together with her retinue.🔽 For enthralling a brahmin, one should offer into the fire sesame seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, one thousand and eight times. He will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a kṣatriya, one should offer into the fire barley smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, one thousand and eight times.🔽 He will be enthralled.

translated: For enthralling a vaiśya, one should offer into the fire black mustard seeds, one thousand and eight times.🔽 He will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a śūdra, one should offer into the fire rice grains, one thousand and eight times.🔽 He will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a woman, one should offer into the fire jasmine flowers, one thousand and eight times.🔽 She will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a man, one should offer into the fire flowers of royal jasmine, one thousand and eight times.🔽 He will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a boy or girl, one should offer into the fire flowers of spider lily, one thousand and eight times.🔽 They will be enthralled.

original: rgyal rigs dbang du byed pa la nas la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: rgyal rigs dbang du byed pa la nas la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: For enthralling a nāga, one should offer into the fire lotus flowers, one thousand and eight times.

original: dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a yakṣa, one should offer into the fire flowers of royal jasmine, one thousand and eight times.🔽 They will be enthralled.

original: rje rigs dbang du byed pa la yungs kar nag po stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: rje rigs dbang du byed pa la yungs kar nag po stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: For enthralling a rākṣasa, one should offer into the fire flowers of royal jasmine, one thousand and eight times.

original: dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a piśāca, one should offer into the fire flowers of royal jasmine, one thousand and eight times.🔽 They will be enthralled.🔽 For enthralling a gandhar

analyzed: dmangs rigs dbang du byed pa la 'bru nag po'i phub ma stong phrag brgyad nyi ma gcig pa'i sbyin sreg gyis shig /

analyzed: nyi ma gsum du ba ser skya khyim du btags te mngon par sngags pa'i rtsa ljang gu zar gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: mngon par sngags nas phreng ba bzang po de dang ldan par bya'o //

analyzed: mngon par sngags te chu 'thung du gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: srung ba byas pa'i phyug rdzis bzho bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas 'o ma de rnam par dben pa'i phyogs su gzhag nas zho chags pa dang / @396b dkrugs par bya'o //

analyzed: mar des m'a la ti'i me tog dang de gcig tu byas nas sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //

analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis padma'i 'dab mas dkris pa'i ril bu blangs nas ji srid dro bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: bsnyen pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis ril bu de ji srid du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar ba dang / 'bar ba de srid du'o //

analyzed: dro bzhin pa la ni dbang du byed pa'o //

original: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba'o //

analyzed: 'bar bas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar byed do //

analyzed: shi nas kyang bde ba can du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rgyal po dbang du byed pa la gzugs brnyan byas nas lag pa g-yon pas mnan nas stong phrag brgya zlos shig /

original: stong dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yungs kar dkar po la mar gyis btags pa stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /

analyzed: de nas blang bar bya ste mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /

translated: In a stūpa together with relics,

analyzed: la gcan dang / sho gam med par mchod par bya bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yungs kar gyis rgyal po dang / blon po thams cad 'joms par byed do //

translated: If one recites over ashes one thousand times, one will be able to ward off thorns in whatever direction one throws them.🔽If one recites eight hundred times, one will be able to remove all splinters.

analyzed: brgyad brgyar bzlas pas zug rdu thams cad med par byed @397b do; ;sngon spyad pa byas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga bzlas so //
translated: “One should perform the preliminary practice, reciting twenty-five hundred thousand times in front of the painting.

translated: Having anointed a maṇḍala of sixteen cubits, one should make a stūpa out of sand, make offerings to it to the best of one’s ability, and, facing east, take up the sword with one’s right hand, raise one’s arm, and

original: gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //

translated: As long as the letters of the inner mantra on the sword blaze, one should take it up and go wherever one wishes. One will become a knowledge-holder, and no knowledge-holder can harm one.

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mi tshugs so //
translated: No sentient being can overpower one.

original: rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro /
analyzed: rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro /

analyzed: ra ba la'ang thad kar 'gro ;rgya mtsho la'ang mngon par 'phags par byed do //

original: nges par bsags pa rnyed do //
analyzed: nges par bsags pa rnyed do //
translated: He will obtain the power of flight.

original: ba bla dang / ldong ros sgrub par 'dod na ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi @398a *//
analyzed: ba bla dang / ldong ros sgrub par 'dod na ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi @398a *//

translated: On the eighth day of the bright fortnight, one should make offerings and place there a man who is not crippled. One should press his chest with one’s left foot and recite the mantra, protecting oneself.

original: // ji srid langs kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: // ji srid langs kyi bar du'o //

original: de nas 'dzag par byed do //
analyzed: de nas 'dzag par byed do //

original: de 'thungs nas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'thungs nas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: gos zung so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: gos zung so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a pair of garments.

analyzed: grong du zhugs nas brgyad brgya bzlas par bya ste mdzes pa'i bza' ba thob par byed do //

analyzed: lan tshva dang bsres pa'i chu la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags pas gzer thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed do //

analyzed: bud med bu ma thon pa la chu la lan brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags nas sbyin no //

original: bde bar btsa' bar byed do //
analyzed: bde bar btsa' bar byed do //

analyzed: rmi lam du ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin ston par byed do //
