original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas de'i spyan sbar mchod pa rgya chen po byas te aa p'a marga dkar po zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa rnams bil ba'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas 'bum sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas de'i spyan sbar mchod pa rgya chen po byas te aa p'a marga dkar po zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa rnams bil ba'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas 'bum sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: In a stūpa containing relics, one should install the painting and make a large offering before it. Having lit a fire of cutch tree sticks, one should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of white rice smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: rgyal srid so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: rgyal srid so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a kingdom.

original: ma grub na grong bsdus pa stong so sor rnyed do //🔽ras ris kyi spyan sngar gi wang ngam /
analyzed: ma grub na grong bsdus pa stong so sor rnyed do // ras ris kyi spyan sngar gi wang ngam /
translated: If [the deity] does not appear, one will obtain a thousand villages.

original: ldong ros la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas nas bskus te dgra bo rnams kyi nang du zhugs na 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldong ros la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas nas bskus te dgra bo rnams kyi nang du zhugs na 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of the painting, one should enchant white mustard seeds or vermilion eight thousand times, and smear [the mustard seeds or vermilion] on oneself. If one enters among one’s enemies, one will not be harmed.

original: dgra bo rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bo rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be harmed by enemies.

original: 'bebs pa la me tog dkar po dang bcas pa'i chu dron la lan gsum bzlas pa dang / ka ra b'i ra'i me tog la lan gsum bzlas pas 'bebs pa la bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bebs pa la me tog dkar po dang bcas pa'i chu dron la lan gsum bzlas pa dang / ka ra b'i ra'i me tog la lan gsum bzlas pas 'bebs pa la bsnun par bya'o //
translated: For inducing rain, one should heat up water with white flowers and incant it twenty-one times, and also beat with karavīra flowers incanted twenty-one times.

original: 'das @401b pa dang; ma 'ongs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'das @401b pa dang; ma 'ongs pa ston par byed do //
translated: One will be able to show the past and the future.

original: 'ching ba ni se gol gyi phyag rgyas shis par byed do //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni se gol gyi phyag rgyas shis par byed do //
translated: For binding, one should make a snap with the mudrā of the thumb and ring finger.

original: mig sman sgrub par 'dod pas dpa' bo'i rin gyis nyos pa'i so'u bi ra'i mig sman spang gcig blangs nas bram ze'i bu mo kha byang du ba ltas pas ba byung lngas 'thag tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mig sman sgrub par 'dod pas dpa' bo'i rin gyis nyos pa'i so'u bi ra'i mig sman spang gcig blangs nas bram ze'i bu mo kha byang du ba ltas pas ba byung lngas 'thag tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “If one wants to perform the siddhi of eye ointment, one should buy svā ointment from a hero, take one pala weight of it, and have a brahmin girl grind it on a white lower garment, facing north, with five sticks of neem wood.

original: ming med kyi sor mos ril bu bzhi byas nas phyogs brgyad kyis rab tu sbar te cho ga 'di nyid kyis mar dang / sra rtsi pog sreg cing stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ming med kyi sor mos ril bu bzhi byas nas phyogs brgyad kyis rab tu sbar te cho ga 'di nyid kyis mar dang / sra rtsi pog sreg cing stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should make four pills with the ring finger of the left hand, heat them over a smokeless fire, and, following the same procedure, offer clarified butter and camphor into the fire and recite the mantra eight thousand times.

original: grong gi mchog bcu rnyed do //
analyzed: grong gi mchog bcu rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain ten excellent villages.

original: cho ga 'di nyid kyis mchod rten byas nas tsandana gyis btags pa'i padma stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di nyid kyis mchod rten byas nas tsandana gyis btags pa'i padma stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having made a reliquary with this very rite, one should offer eight thousand lotuses smeared with saffron.

original: yul gyi bdag po nyid stong so sor rnyed do //🔽bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas nas bdug pa bsregs te tsam pa ka'i me tog stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste gser so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po nyid stong so sor rnyed do // bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas nas bdug pa bsregs te tsam pa ka'i me tog stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste gser so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a thousand villages.🔽Having made a reliquary the size of a Sugata, having burned incense, one should offer eight thousand campaka flowers. One will obtain a thousand measures of gold.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas te me tog gi ge sar stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste gos stong so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas te me tog gi ge sar stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste gos stong so sor rnyed do //
translated: Having made a reliquary the size of a Sugata, one should offer eight thousand flowers of the karavīra plant. One will obtain a thousand garments.

original: de bzhin du me tog thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: In the same way, all flowers are desired in the rite.

original: dur khrod nas ro bsregs pa'i thal ba blangs te zla ba nya la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ming med kyi sor mo'i khrag gi zlum po byas nas gzugs brnyan bris te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas stong zlos shig /
analyzed: dur khrod nas ro bsregs pa'i thal ba blangs te zla ba nya la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ming med kyi sor mo'i khrag gi zlum po byas nas gzugs brnyan bris te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas stong zlos shig /
translated: Take the ashes of a cremation ground, and on the full moon, fasting day and night, make a circle with the blood of the ring finger, draw the image, and trample it with your left foot while reciting the mantra one thousand times.

original: rigs brgyud dang bcas pa dbang du byed do //
analyzed: rigs brgyud dang bcas pa dbang du byed do //
translated: He will be brought under one's power together with his family.

original: @402a *// bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas nas 'bras yos la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i me la sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad gyis shig /
analyzed: @402a *// bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi mchod rten byas nas 'bras yos la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i me la sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad gyis shig /
translated: Make a stūpa of the Blessed One one handspan in size, and offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of parched rice mixed with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: gi wang la stong du mngon par sngags pas thig le byas na gang mthong ba dang / gang rnams mthong ba de rnams dbang du byed do //
analyzed: gi wang la stong du mngon par sngags pas thig le byas na gang mthong ba dang / gang rnams mthong ba de rnams dbang du byed do //
translated: If one makes a bindu with the essence of long pepper enchanted one thousand times, whoever one sees or they see, they will be brought under one's power.

original: tho rangs tu rushka'i chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas te gdong bkrus pas gang mthong ba de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: tho rangs tu rushka'i chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas te gdong bkrus pas gang mthong ba de sbyin par byed do //

original: thams cad de kho na bzhin du til mar za bas khyor ba'i chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas te 'thungs shig /
analyzed: thams cad de kho na bzhin du til mar za bas khyor ba'i chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas te 'thungs shig /

original: rgyal po'i pho brang du rab tu zhugs te chos gos de blangs te lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas te lag pa g-yon pas mdud pa byas nas thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chom rkun gyi nang du dran par byed cing bzlas pas 'ching ba grol bar byed do //

translated: One should make effigies of the weapons, such as swords, spears, and so forth, out of palāśa wood, white karavīra, and white mustard seeds, and trample them with one’s left foot in front of the painting, reciting the mantra eight thousand times.

original: sngags rnams spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags rnams spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to ward off weapons.

analyzed: klu mo dang bcas pa dbang du 'gyur ro //

translated: Fasting day and night, on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should make an offering at a crossroads and sit down. One should make a pill the size of a bean from red arsenic, place it in one’s mouth, and recite the mantra until one’s mouth is filled with smoke.

original: ldong ros grub par 'gyur te dpral bar thig le byas pas mi snang ngo //
analyzed: ldong ros grub par 'gyur te dpral bar thig le byas pas mi snang ngo //
translated: The red arsenic will be accomplished. By applying it to one’s forehead, one will become invisible.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs can lo lnga brgyar 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs can lo lnga brgyar 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: One will live for five hundred years in the form of a desired being.

original: nag po'i brgyad pa la khri'i tshogs can blangs nas gzhan mo'i brgyad pa la khro tshogs can la rtse gsum byed du gzhug go /

analyzed: gzhan pa'i nag po'i brgyad pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas dur khrod du song nas rtse gsum la mchod pa chen po byas nas skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug ste lag pa g-yas pas rtse gsum blangs nas ji srid rtse gsum las 'od zer
translated: On another eighth day of the dark lunar fortnight, one should go to the charnel ground, having fasted for a day and a night, and make a great offering to the trident. Sitting down cross-legged, one should take up the trident with one’s right hand and recite the mantra until light rays

original: byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: issue from the trident.

analyzed: de nas grub par 'gyur te mtshan mo ma brtsigs pa ru lha'i khyim 'byung ste rgyan thams cad @403b kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i bud med 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, one will become accomplished. At night, a divine house will appear in the sky, and a woman will appear, adorned with all ornaments.

original: 'khor gyi skyes bu mang po'ang dgod pa dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kun khyab par nye bar gnas te gang bsams pa de thams cad rnyed do //
analyzed: 'khor gyi skyes bu mang po'ang dgod pa dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kun khyab par nye bar gnas te gang bsams pa de thams cad rnyed do //
translated: Many beings of the retinue will also appear, laughing, flirting, and so forth, and will remain, filling the place. One will obtain everything that one wishes for.

original: tho rangs ston pas thams cad 'jog go /
analyzed: tho rangs ston pas thams cad 'jog go /
translated: At dawn, the Teacher will dismiss everyone.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar tshangs ma'i khu ba zho gang la brgyad brgyar zlos la 'thungs shig /

translated: Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should observe a daily fast and, in front of the painting, drink a pint of the milk of a tawny cow, over which the mantra has been recited one hundred and eight times.

original: nyi ma bdun gyis thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will retain what one hears for seven days.

translated: In front of the painting, one should perform the various types of protection and recite the mantra over a morsel of food as long as it lasts.

original: de nas grub par 'gyur te phyi nas zan 'pho bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas grub par 'gyur te phyi nas zan 'pho bar byed do //
translated: One will then become successful and will be able to make the food last.

original: 'bru la skyes pa'ang ngo //

analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas lcags gsum las byung ba'i 'khor lo sor bcu drug pa'i rnam pa byas nas nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas rtsa ba'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas 'khor lo aa shvattha'i

original: 'dab ma bdun la bzhag ste skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma bdun la bzhag ste skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should place the wheel on the petals of an aśvattha leaf, sit in the cross-legged posture, and recite the mantra until it blazes.

original: de nas blangs pa tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog can rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur te gang rnams kyi mthong ba de rnams dang lhan cig 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas blangs pa tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog can rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur te gang rnams kyi mthong ba de rnams dang lhan cig 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by merely taking it, one will become a rākṣasa king, with curly hair, the color of the rising sun, a master of the wheel of the vidyādharas, and will fly together with those whom one sees.

original: 'bar ba can legs par mthong ba @404a *//
analyzed: 'bar ba can legs par mthong ba @404a *//
translated: If one sees the blazing one well,

original: blangs nas lag pas mnan te lan bdun bzlas pa byas nas gang la reg pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blangs nas lag pas mnan te lan bdun bzlas pa byas nas gang la reg pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: takes it, presses it with one’s hand, and recites the mantra seven times, whoever one touches will become enthralled.

original: ku sha las byung ba'i 'khor lo byas nas lan bdun bzlas pa chur bcug ste klu rnams langs nas ci bgyi zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: ku sha las byung ba'i 'khor lo byas nas lan bdun bzlas pa chur bcug ste klu rnams langs nas ci bgyi zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: Having made a wheel out of kuśa grass, having enchanted it seven times, one should place it in water. The nāgas will rise up and say, “What is to be done?”

original: dong tse 'bum byin cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dong tse 'bum byin cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, “Give me a hundred thousand gold coins!”

original: slong mo za zhing ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should go begging for alms, climb to the peak of a mountain, and recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times. The body of the Tathāgata will appear.

original: de mthong nas 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de mthong nas 'grub par byed do //
translated: Having seen that, one will become accomplished.

original: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas aarga'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas aarga'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: Having entered a river that flows into the ocean, one should perform a homa with arka flowers.

original: nyi ma mchog spyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma mchog spyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sun will grant a boon.

original: hu klung de nyid du rked pa nub tsam du zhugs nas pil ba'i me tog rab tu lhug cig /
analyzed: hu klung de nyid du rked pa nub tsam du zhugs nas pil ba'i me tog rab tu lhug cig /
translated: Having entered that very river up to one’s waist, one should loosen bilva flowers.

original: mes pos mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes pos mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s grandfather will grant a boon.

original: manda ra ba'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: manda ra ba'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: One should perform a homa with mandāra flowers.

original: dbang pos mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang pos mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Indra will grant a boon.

original: de nyid chu la mand'a ra ba'i me tog gis nor sbyin mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid chu la mand'a ra ba'i me tog gis nor sbyin mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If one offers a sacrifice of māndārava flowers to the water, one will obtain wealth.

original: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “One should recite the mantra two hundred thousand times.

original: rgyal por 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal por 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: One will become a king.

original: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “One should recite the mantra three hundred thousand times.

original: sems can thams cad 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gugs par byed do //
translated: One will summon all beings.

original: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs te mya ngan med pa'i shing gi me tog stong phrag brgya blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs te mya ngan med pa'i shing gi me tog stong phrag brgya blugs par bya'o //
translated: “One should enter the water of a river that flows into the ocean and offer one hundred thousand flowers of the aśoka tree.

original: mtshan mo bdun gyis gnod sbyin mo rnams 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo bdun gyis gnod sbyin mo rnams 'gugs par byed do //
translated: Within seven nights one will summon the yakṣiṇīs.

original: @404b shing la mi smra bar zla ba drug tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: @404b shing la mi smra bar zla ba drug tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “One should recite the mantra six months without speaking.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain whatever substance one desires.

original: aarga las byung ba'i rgyal po'i gzugs brnyan sor drug pa byas nas kha dog ma 'dres pas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: aarga las byung ba'i rgyal po'i gzugs brnyan sor drug pa byas nas kha dog ma 'dres pas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “One should commission a clay statue of the king, six fingers high, with all the ornaments, and painted in various colors.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a king of the maṇḍala.

original: yang na rig pa 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na rig pa 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, he will become a knowledge-holder.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar mi smra bar zla ba drug du lag pa g-yon pa la mngon par sngags nas khri yongs su bzlas te nye bar gyur pa'i gter 'bum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar mi smra bar zla ba drug du lag pa g-yon pa la mngon par sngags nas khri yongs su bzlas te nye bar gyur pa'i gter 'bum 'byung ngo //
translated: In front of the painting, without speaking, for six months, having enchanted one’s left hand, one should recite the mantra ten thousand times.

original: 'bras yos la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag bcu dang / aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag bcu sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: 'bras yos la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag bcu dang / aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag bcu sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of parched rice smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, and one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the apāmārga plant smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: gser stong phrag bcu so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: gser stong phrag bcu so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain one thousand measures of gold.

original: gi wang blangs te ril bu byas nas lcags gsum gyis dkri'o //
analyzed: gi wang blangs te ril bu byas nas lcags gsum gyis dkri'o //
translated: One should take costus root, make it into pills, and wrap them in the three metals.

original: de nas gtsang zhing dkar ba'i gos bgos te dur khrod du song nas dri dang / bdug pa dang; me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin te ril bu thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas ji srid 'jigs pa'i sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gtsang zhing dkar ba'i gos bgos te dur khrod du song nas dri dang / bdug pa dang; me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin te ril bu thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas ji srid 'jigs pa'i sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having put on clean white clothes, one should go to a charnel ground, make offerings of perfume, incense, flowers, and so on, give a bali to all the bhūtas, place the pill in a skull cup, and recite the mantra until one hears a frightening sound.

original: 'jigs par mi 'gyur grogs rnams la bgos nas yang khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi 'gyur grogs rnams la bgos nas yang khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should share it with one’s friends, and by placing it in one’s mouth one will become invisible.

original: lo stong phrag bcur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //🔽phag gi mig @405a *//
analyzed: lo stong phrag bcur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro // phag gi mig @405a *//
translated: One will live for ten thousand years.

original: blangs nas phyugs dang lhan cig gzhon nu ma'i lag pas btab bar bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas phyugs dang lhan cig gzhon nu ma'i lag pas btab bar bya'o //
translated: One should take a pig’s eye, and with the hand of a young girl one should rub it with cow dung.

original: ril bu byas nas lcags gsum gyis dkris te lag pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas dbang phyug chen po'i sku'i g-yas phyogs su kham phor kha sbyar du bzhag ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas ji srid shi ta'i sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ril bu byas nas lcags gsum gyis dkris te lag pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas dbang phyug chen po'i sku'i g-yas phyogs su kham phor kha sbyar du bzhag ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas ji srid shi ta'i sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Recite until you hear the sound of “chit.”

original: rig pa bzlas te grogs rnams la'ang byin nas khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa bzlas te grogs rnams la'ang byin nas khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Give it to your friends, and they will become invisible.

original: bsgrub par bya ba thams cad kun tu dga' ba dang / lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba thams cad kun tu dga' ba dang / lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: It will please all those to be subdued, and they will live for a thousand years.

original: padma ge sar dang / mig sman dang / ldong ros kyang rung ste cha mnyam par byas nas gso sbyong can gyi bu mo'i lag pas btab par bya'o //
analyzed: padma ge sar dang / mig sman dang / ldong ros kyang rung ste cha mnyam par byas nas gso sbyong can gyi bu mo'i lag pas btab par bya'o //
translated: Take saffron, eye medicine, and realgar, and make them equal parts.

original: lcags gsum gyis dkris pa byas nas sngon spyad pa byas pa rgyal po'i sbyor bas dbang phyug chen po'i sku'i g-yas su 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma phul nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas te kham phor kha sbyar du bzhag nas lag pa g-yas pas mnan te ji srid kha ta kha ta zhes sgrogs pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags gsum gyis dkris pa byas nas sngon spyad pa byas pa rgyal po'i sbyor bas dbang phyug chen po'i sku'i g-yas su 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma phul nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas te kham phor kha sbyar du bzhag nas lag pa g-yas pas mnan te ji srid kha ta kha ta zhes sgrogs pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the preliminary practice, one should offer a bali to all the bhūtas to the right of the form of Maheśvara. Having made offerings of perfume, flowers, and incense, one should place the bali in a covered vessel and press it down with one’s right hand. One should recite the mantra until one hears the sound “kata-kata.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gcig phul nas grogs rnams la'ang bgos te khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gcig phul nas grogs rnams la'ang bgos te khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having offered one bali to the Blessed Buddha, one should distribute the rest to one’s companions and place it in one’s mouth. One will become invisible.

original: lo stong du 'tsho bar byed do //🔽sngon spyad pa byas pas @405b 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing ri'i rtse mor ras ris bzhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lo stong du 'tsho bar byed do // sngon spyad pa byas pas @405b 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing ri'i rtse mor ras ris bzhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One will live one thousand years.🔽Having performed the preliminary practice, one should eat milk and barley, and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times while sitting in front of the painting on the peak of a mountain.

original: de nas gso sbyong can gyis grog mkhar gyis rtag tu blangs nas 'o mas sbyar te 'jam par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas gso sbyong can gyis grog mkhar gyis rtag tu blangs nas 'o mas sbyar te 'jam par byas nas /
translated: Then, having taken a termite hill, one should mix it with milk and grind it well.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshod kyi ngang pa bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshod kyi ngang pa bya'o //
translated: One should draw a two-cubit-tall image of the Sugata.

original: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong can gyis kha dog ma 'dres pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong can gyis kha dog ma 'dres pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: A painter who has taken the purificatory fast should draw it with unmixed colors.

original: de nas rnam par dben pa'i phyogs su ras ris bzhugs nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod de 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin nas gos gtsang ma bgos pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji srid ngang pa g-yo bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam par dben pa'i phyogs su ras ris bzhugs nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod de 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin nas gos gtsang ma bgos pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji srid ngang pa g-yo bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed the painting in an isolated place, one should offer worship with perfume, flowers, and incense, give a bali offering to all the spirits, and, dressed in clean clothes, recite the mantra in front of the painting until the peacock moves.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas sngar yongs su bzlas pa'i gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog mchod yon dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas sngar yongs su bzlas pa'i gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog mchod yon dbul par bya'o //
translated: Then the knower of mantra should offer water for the feet to the other Aparājitā flowers previously enchanted.

original: slar yang brgyad brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang brgyad brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra again eight hundred times.

original: thams cad 'ong bar byed de 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad 'ong bar byed de 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: All of them will come. One should not be afraid.

original: sngags bzlas pa'i rma byas reg par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa'i rma byas reg par bya'o //
translated: One should touch them with the enchanted peacock feather.

original: ci bgyi zhes smra bar byed do; ;lus kyi nang du son par gyur cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci bgyi zhes smra bar byed do; ;lus kyi nang du son par gyur cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He will say, ‘What can I do?’ One should say, ‘Enter my body.’

original: de nas sgrub pa po'i lus su mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po'i lus su mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then he will disappear and enter the practitioner’s body.

original: skad cig de nyid la skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: In that very moment, one’s hair will become curly,

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
translated: one will have the appearance of a sixteen-year-old,

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog ltar snang ba /
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog ltar snang ba /
translated: and one will shine like the rising sun.

original: thogs pa med par 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: thogs pa med par 'gro bar byed do //
translated: One will be able to travel without impediment.

original: gang mthong ba dang / lta bar byed pa de dang lhan cig 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mthong ba dang / lta bar byed pa de dang lhan cig 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will fly together with whomever one sees and looks at.

original: @406a *// rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad 'di'i dbang du 'gyur te bskal par gnas shing gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @406a *// rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad 'di'i dbang du 'gyur te bskal par gnas shing gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the vidyādharas will be under one’s control, and one will live for an eon. When one dies, one will be reborn among the gods.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One who has previously performed the service should install the painting in a stūpa that contains relics and recite the mantra five hundred thousand times.

original: gso sbyong can gyis mi smra bar thog phog pa'i shing blangs nas 'o mar nyin zhag bdun du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong can gyis mi smra bar thog phog pa'i shing blangs nas 'o mar nyin zhag bdun du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One who is fasting should take a piece of wood struck by lightning, and infuse it in milk for seven days.

original: de nas phyung ste sa dkar po dang / tsandana gyi chus mnyes pas ji srid rdo rje phog pa'i shing 'khrur gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyung ste sa dkar po dang / tsandana gyi chus mnyes pas ji srid rdo rje phog pa'i shing 'khrur gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken it out, one should wash it with white clay and sandalwood water until the piece of wood struck by lightning is clean.

original: de nas sgrub pa po gso sbyong can gyis bzo bos seng+ge byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po gso sbyong can gyis bzo bos seng+ge byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then the practitioner, who is fasting, should have the carpenter make a lion.

original: de nas rgyu skar snar ma la dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen byas nas dge 'dun gyis bstan pa'i slong mo bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyu skar snar ma la dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen byas nas dge 'dun gyis bstan pa'i slong mo bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, under the Pūrvāṣāḍhā lunar mansion, after making vast offerings to the Three Jewels, one should eat alms-food given by the Saṅgha.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In front of the painting, having made vast offerings, one should offer various kinds of bali.

original: de nas sgrub pa po gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pas lag pa g-yas pas seng+ge mnan te ji srid seng+ge g-yo bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pas lag pa g-yas pas seng+ge mnan te ji srid seng+ge g-yo bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then the practitioner, pure and wearing clean clothes, should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass. With his right hand he should press down on the lion and recite the mantra until the lion moves.

original: g-yos pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan ma skye ste 'jigs par mi byed do //
analyzed: g-yos pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan ma skye ste 'jigs par mi byed do //
translated: When it moves, various signs will arise, but he should not be afraid.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i yungs kar rnams kyis seng+ge la gzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i yungs kar rnams kyis seng+ge la gzhu bar bya'o //
translated: Then the awareness holder should strike the lion with mustard seeds enchanted seven times.

original: seng+ge sgra @406b chen po sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: seng+ge sgra @406b chen po sgrogs par byed do //
translated: The lion will roar loudly.

original: sgrub pa po'ang ma bsams par dgon pa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'ang ma bsams par dgon pa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The practitioner will not pass beyond the wilderness without thinking about it.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos lan bdun brjod nas seng+ge la 'jogs te rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyang 'dus na seng+ge la zhon te 'khor dang bcas pa 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos lan bdun brjod nas seng+ge la 'jogs te rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyang 'dus na seng+ge la zhon te 'khor dang bcas pa 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the practitioner, having enchanted seven times, should strike the lion. All the awareness holders will gather. Riding the lion, he will fly away with his retinue.

original: yid kyis rlung ltar 'gro ba dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor du ma dang / bskal par gnas shing gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe gang du 'dod par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyis rlung ltar 'gro ba dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor du ma dang / bskal par gnas shing gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe gang du 'dod par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to go anywhere by merely thinking of it, and one will be able to remain for an eon. When one dies, one will be reborn wherever one wishes.

original: seng+ge'i sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: seng+ge'i sgrub thabs so //
translated: The sādhana of the lion.

original: nor sgrub par byed par 'dod na dkar po'i zla ba nya nas brtsams te mi smra par 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing ji snyed phyi ma zla ba gsum gyi bar du ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nor sgrub par byed par 'dod na dkar po'i zla ba nya nas brtsams te mi smra par 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing ji snyed phyi ma zla ba gsum gyi bar du ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to accomplish wealth, one should commence on the full moon of a bright fortnight, observing silence, subsisting on a diet of milk and barley, and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times before the painting.

original: de nas ras ris g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ras ris g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the painting will move.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs brnyan g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs brnyan g-yo bar byed do //
translated: Also, the image of the Tathāgata will move.

original: nor gyi dngos grub chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor gyi dngos grub chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain great wealth.

original: n'i la ta ka la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags te mdud pa bya'o //
analyzed: n'i la ta ka la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags te mdud pa bya'o //
translated: One should enchant a nīlī thread eight hundred times and tie it around one’s head.

original: gyad g-yul du rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyad g-yul du rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be victorious in wrestling.

original: thal ba la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te spyi bor bzhag par byas na g-yul du rgyal bar 'gyur te gyad kyi dngos grub bo //
analyzed: thal ba la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te spyi bor bzhag par byas na g-yul du rgyal bar 'gyur te gyad kyi dngos grub bo //
translated: Having enchanted ashes twenty-one times, one should place them on the crown of the head; one will be victorious in battle—this is the power of the wrestler.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas 'o ma dang lhan cig zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste brgyad brgyar mngon par bzlas pa byas nas 'thungs shig /🔽de bzhin @407a *//
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas 'o ma dang lhan cig zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste brgyad brgyar mngon par bzlas pa byas nas 'thungs shig / de bzhin @407a *//
translated: Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should place it in a copper vessel together with milk and, having enchanted it eight hundred times, one should drink it.

original: du nyi ma bdun gyis thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du nyi ma bdun gyis thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one should drink it for seven days.🔽One will become a vidyādhara.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhal nas 'od zer byung ste sgrub pa pos bskor ba byas nas steng du 'gro ste rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhal nas 'od zer byung ste sgrub pa pos bskor ba byas nas steng du 'gro ste rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: A light ray issues from the mouth of Noble Avalokiteśvara, circles the practitioner, goes up, and one becomes a vidyādhara.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs can lo brgya stong phrag gsum du 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs can lo brgya stong phrag gsum du 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: One will live for three hundred thousand years in a desired form.

original: nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gcig smyung bar gnas pas gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du gi wang bzhag nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gcig smyung bar gnas pas gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du gi wang bzhag nas ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: On the eighth day of the dark fortnight, having fasted all night, one should place realgar in front of the image and recite the mantra until it smokes.

original: de'i tshe blang bar bya ste blangs pa tsam la sred med kyi bu'i stobs su 'gyur te gzhan gyi mtshon cha rnams mthu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe blang bar bya ste blangs pa tsam la sred med kyi bu'i stobs su 'gyur te gzhan gyi mtshon cha rnams mthu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one should take it. By merely taking it, one will have the strength of Nārāyaṇa, and the weapons of others will be ineffective.

original: gang phreng ba dang ldan pa de gnas pas lo sum brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: gang phreng ba dang ldan pa de gnas pas lo sum brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: One who possesses the garland will live for three hundred years by the power of the mantra.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar bil ba'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas be kangka ta'i yam shing la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa stong phrag brgyar sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar bil ba'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas be kangka ta'i yam shing la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa stong phrag brgyar sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: “On the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should fast for one day and one night, light a fire with sticks of the banyan tree in front of the painting, and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the cutch tree smeared with hot sesame oil.

original: dong tse gcig rnyed do //
analyzed: dong tse gcig rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain one gold coin.

original: dkar po'i bcu gsum pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas sa las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i lha byas nas de'i khar 'bras thug po che'i stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: dkar po'i bcu gsum pa la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas sa las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i lha byas nas de'i khar 'bras thug po che'i stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: “On the thirteenth day of the bright fortnight, one should fast for one day and one night, make an image of the god of love from clay, and offer into it one hundred thousand oblations of rice gruel.

original: nyi ma bdun la gnag bu mo 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun la gnag bu mo 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Within seven days, the desired maiden will be brought under one’s power.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas dur khrod du song @407b ste sa la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byug pa byas nas ma nyams pa'i thod pa blangs te tsandana dmar po'i chus bkrus nas me tog
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas dur khrod du song @407b ste sa la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byug pa byas nas ma nyams pa'i thod pa blangs te tsandana dmar po'i chus bkrus nas me tog
translated: On the fourteenth day of the dark lunar fortnight, one should fast for a day and night, go to a charnel ground, and anoint the ground with cow dung that has not fallen on the ground.🔽Taking an undamaged skull cup, washing it with red sandalwood water, and worshipping it with red flowers,

original: dmar po dang / dri dang / me tog gis mngon par mchod cing de nas thod pa la nye bar 'dug ste gsang sngags bzlas pas dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: dmar po dang / dri dang / me tog gis mngon par mchod cing de nas thod pa la nye bar 'dug ste gsang sngags bzlas pas dgug par bya'o //
translated: incense, and lamps, one should then sit on the skull cup and summon the target with the mantra recitation.

original: ji srid thod pa g-yo bar gyur pa de srid du'o //
analyzed: ji srid thod pa g-yo bar gyur pa de srid du'o //
translated: One should do this until the skull cup shakes.

original: de'i che grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i che grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it will be accomplished.

original: de'i tshe sen mos gang bkug pa de 'ong ste gang brjod pa de byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sen mos gang bkug pa de 'ong ste gang brjod pa de byed do //
translated: At that time, whoever one pinches with one’s fingernails will come and do whatever one says.

original: zhi bar byed par 'dod na ras ris kyi spyan sngar padma stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: zhi bar byed par 'dod na ras ris kyi spyan sngar padma stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: If one wishes to pacify, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight lotuses in front of the painting.

original: zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: [The target] will be pacified.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar m'a la ti'i me tog zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar m'a la ti'i me tog zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: In front of the painting, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of mālatī flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: [The king] will become pacified.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pa nag po'i bco lnga pa la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas mchod pa chen po byas te gtor ma rgya chen po dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pa nag po'i bco lnga pa la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas mchod pa chen po byas te gtor ma rgya chen po dbul bar bya'o //
translated: “One who has previously performed the rite should, on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, set up the painting in a caitya that contains relics, make a great offering, and offer a large pūjā.

original: phyi rol tu 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin te de nas n'a ga ge sar gyi phye mas gzugs brnyan bris shig /
analyzed: phyi rol tu 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin te de nas n'a ga ge sar gyi phye mas gzugs brnyan bris shig /
translated: Having given an offering to all the bhūtas outside, one should draw the image with the powder of ironwood blossoms.

original: dkyil 'khor bcing ba'ang byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste ji srid du skar mda' ltung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bcing ba'ang byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste ji srid du skar mda' ltung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having also made a maṇḍala fence, one should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass and recite [the mantra] until a shooting star falls.

original: slar yang ji srid ras ris 'gul ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang ji srid ras ris 'gul ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Again, one should recite [the mantra] until the painting moves.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma gzhan rnams kyang 'byung ste de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @408a *//
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma gzhan rnams kyang 'byung ste de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @408a *//
translated: Other signs of accomplishment will also occur.

original: thams cad la phyag byas nas 'phur ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la phyag byas nas 'phur ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having made obeisance to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one will become a space-walking vidyādhara.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs can dpag tshad stong nas mthong bar byed cing thos par byed do /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs can dpag tshad stong nas mthong bar byed cing thos par byed do /
translated: One will be able to see and hear forms of one’s choice up to a thousand leagues away.

original: rig pa 'dzin thams cad kyis gnod pa med do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin thams cad kyis gnod pa med do //
translated: One will be safe from all vidyādharas.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas nag po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas ma nyams pa'i lus blangs te dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod nas lag pa g-yas pas byin te ji srid du 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas nag po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas ma nyams pa'i lus blangs te dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod nas lag pa g-yas pas byin te ji srid du 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “If one performs the preliminary practice, on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight one should fast for a day and a night, make vast offerings, take a body that has not been cremated, and offer oblations of incense, flowers, and perfume.

original: 'bar ba tsam gyis rig pa 'dzin pa stong gis yongs su bskor te nam mkha'i mthil du 'phur bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bar ba tsam gyis rig pa 'dzin pa stong gis yongs su bskor te nam mkha'i mthil du 'phur bar byed do //
translated: As soon as it bursts into flames, one will fly up surrounded by a thousand vidyādharas into the vault of space.

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
translated: The form of an eight- or twelve-year-old,

original: skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: with curly hair,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyis gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyis gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: is invincible to all vidyādharas.

original: 'bebs pa la 'dug pas so //
analyzed: 'bebs pa la 'dug pas so //
translated: For summoning, he should sit.

original: dug 'joms pa la yal 'dab kyis so //
analyzed: dug 'joms pa la yal 'dab kyis so //
translated: For destroying poison, he should use a branch.

original: bdag nyid srung ba la bzlas pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid srung ba la bzlas pas so //
translated: For self-protection, he should recite.

original: dkar po'i bcu bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar gso sbyong can gyis dag pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i bcu bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar gso sbyong can gyis dag pa gos gtsang ma bgos pas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Beginning on the fourteenth of the bright fortnight until the fifteenth, he should recite in front of the image, observing the purificatory fast, wearing clean white clothes.

original: gang 'dod pa de thob par byed do //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de thob par byed do //
translated: He will obtain whatever he desires.

original: mar la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags par byas nas 'thungs shig /
analyzed: mar la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags par byas nas 'thungs shig /
translated: Having enchanted ghee eight hundred times, he should drink it.

original: nyi ma bdun gyis yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In seven days he will become wise.

original: ras ris kyis spyan sngar ma lli ka'i me tog stong phrag brgyad sbyin @408b sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: ras ris kyis spyan sngar ma lli ka'i me tog stong phrag brgyad sbyin @408b sreg gyis shig /
translated: In front of the painting, he should offer into the fire one thousand and eight Malli flowers.

original: mtshan mo bdun la rdzas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo bdun la rdzas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In seven nights he will obtain wealth.

original: dkar po'i bcu bzhi la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: dkar po'i bcu bzhi la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: On the fourteenth of the bright fortnight, having fasted for three nights, one should light a fire with sticks of udumbara wood and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of udumbara wood smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: dong tse lnga brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: dong tse lnga brgya rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain five hundred kārṣāpaṇas.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la gso sbyong can gyis mar me stong phrag brgyad sbar nas mar me 'khyil ba stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la gso sbyong can gyis mar me stong phrag brgyad sbar nas mar me 'khyil ba stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: On the fourteenth of the dark fortnight, having fasted, one should light eight thousand lamps and offer into them one thousand and eight oblations of burning rags.

original: phyi nas bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra afterward.

original: de nas mig thob par byed do //
analyzed: de nas mig thob par byed do //
translated: One will then obtain the divine eye.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du bzhugs nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas te sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag bya ba byas nas nyi ma gcig la thun gsum du yongs su bzlas pa lan bcu gnyis su bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du bzhugs nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas te sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag bya ba byas nas nyi ma gcig la thun gsum du yongs su bzlas pa lan bcu gnyis su bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having placed the book of the Perfection of Wisdom together with relics in a stūpa, one should enchant it one thousand and eight times, and having made prostrations to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one should recite it twelve times in three sessions during the day.

original: rna ba so sor rnyed do //🔽nad la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ting nge 'dzin nges par skyes pa'i cho gas ras sam /
analyzed: rna ba so sor rnyed do // nad la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ting nge 'dzin nges par skyes pa'i cho gas ras sam /
translated: One will regain one’s hearing.

original: 'bras bu can la kha dog ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu can la kha dog ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: For an illness, one should have painted on cloth or on fruit the noble Avalokiteśvara, born from the concentration, according to the rite.

original: de'i spyan sngar mchod pa chen po byas nas stong phrag brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar mchod pa chen po byas nas stong phrag brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In front of it, having made a great offering, one should recite [the mantra] one thousand and eight times.

original: ku sha'i stan la 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing dus gsum du khrus byed cing gtsang ma bgos pas yan lag brgyad ldan pa'i gso sbyong @409a *//
analyzed: ku sha'i stan la 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing dus gsum du khrus byed cing gtsang ma bgos pas yan lag brgyad ldan pa'i gso sbyong @409a *//
translated: They sit on a seat of kuśa grass, eat milk and barley, bathe three times a day, and are pure and wear clean clothes.🔽

original: can gyis tshes gcig nas brtsams nas ji srid gcig gi bar du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: can gyis tshes gcig nas brtsams nas ji srid gcig gi bar du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: He should observe the eight-part purification-renewal, and, beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, he should offer the recitation.

original: de nas nad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the illness will be completely cured.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pa'i 'o ma dang / nas zan za ba'am /
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pa'i 'o ma dang / nas zan za ba'am /
translated: He should eat milk and rice, as before, and observe the eight-part purification-renewal.

original: ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan za bas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing gso sbyong can gyis ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas mar me brgyad so sor sbar te padma stong gis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan za bas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing gso sbyong can gyis ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs nas mar me brgyad so sor sbar te padma stong gis mchod par bya'o //
translated: He should bathe three times a day, eat cow urine and rice, and, observing the eight-part purification-renewal, he should place the painting in a caitya containing relics and light eight butter lamps, each the size of a doṇa measure, and make offerings with a thousand lotuses.

original: nag po'i phyogs la bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la bzlas par bya'o //
translated: He should recite at night.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: He should begin the practice on the first day of the bright fortnight.

original: zla ba nya la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas te mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba nya la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas te mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “If one fasts for three nights on the full moon day, makes extensive offerings, and recites the mantra throughout the night,

original: gal te rgyal por 'gyur na sgrub pa po'i khang pa 'bar bar byed cing me tog gi chun bu g-yo bar byed na dkyil 'khor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyal por 'gyur na sgrub pa po'i khang pa 'bar bar byed cing me tog gi chun bu g-yo bar byed na dkyil 'khor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: if the practitioner’s house is filled with light and the flower garland moves, he will become a king of the maṇḍala.🔽“In front of the painting, one should make a maṇḍala out of white sandalwood, offer incense, flowers, perfume, and so forth, and also a bali. One should take three hundred lotus flowers, incant them eight hundred times, light three butter lamps, and make a fire burning sticks of udumbara wood.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar tsandana dkar pos dkyil 'khro byas nas dri dang / me tog dang; bdug pa la sogs pa dang / gtor ma'ang phul nas me tog gi ge sar brgya phrag gsum blangs te brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags par byas nas mar gyi mar me gsum sbar te au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis mer rab tu sbar nas me tog re re la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar tsandana dkar pos dkyil 'khro byas nas dri dang / me tog dang; bdug pa la sogs pa dang / gtor ma'ang phul nas me tog gi ge sar brgya phrag gsum blangs te brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags par byas nas mar gyi mar me gsum sbar te au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis mer rab tu sbar nas me tog re re la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags
translated: One should offer into the fire each flower, incanting it eight hundred times.

original: par byas nas mar gyis byugs te sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: par byas nas mar gyis byugs te sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should anoint it with ghee and offer it into the fire.

original: gang 'dod pa @409b de dbang du 'gyur ro //

translated: Having performed the preliminary practice, having purified the body with the five cow products, having bathed three times a day, one should drink milk.

original: rtsa ba'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar brgyad brgya bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar brgyad brgya bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In front of the principal painting, one should recite [the mantra] eight hundred times.

original: phyi nas nag po'i brgyad pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji ltar nus pa'i mchod pa byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste bil ba'i yam shing la mar dang; zho dang / sbrang rtsi btags pa stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: phyi nas nag po'i brgyad pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar ji ltar nus pa'i mchod pa byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste bil ba'i yam shing la mar dang; zho dang / sbrang rtsi btags pa stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: Later, on the eighth day of the dark lunar fortnight, one should make offerings in front of the painting to the best of one’s ability, sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, and perform a homa of bilva sticks smeared with ghee, milk, and honey, one thousand and eight times.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi spyi bo nas 'od zer 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi spyi bo nas 'od zer 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Noble Mañjuśrī will emit light from his head.

original: des sgrub pa po la bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sgrub pa po la bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will circle around the practitioner and disappear in front of the image of the Blessed One.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong ste mchog gsum po rnams gang gnyer ba de rnyed do //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong ste mchog gsum po rnams gang gnyer ba de rnyed do //
translated: Then one will see Noble Avalokiteśvara and obtain the three boons that one desires.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi rgyal srid dang / khyod ji 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das de 'dra ba nga'o zhes so //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi rgyal srid dang / khyod ji 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das de 'dra ba nga'o zhes so //
translated: One will obtain the kingdom of the vidyādharas and the state of being like the Blessed One.

original: dngos grub 'di ni bla ma mchod pa dang / snying rjes sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas sbyin pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed do //🔽nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas aarga'i yam @415a *//
analyzed: dngos grub 'di ni bla ma mchod pa dang / snying rjes sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas sbyin pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed do // nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas aarga'i yam @415a *//
translated: This power is achieved by worshipping the guru and by giving equally to all beings with compassion.

original: shing gi stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: shing gi stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: Having fasted day and night, make a great offering in front of the painting and perform a homa of arghāya sticks eight thousand times.

original: gang 'dod pa de skad cig nyid la 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de skad cig nyid la 'gugs par byed do //
translated: Whatever is desired, that will be summoned in an instant.

original: aa ka ru dang / pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar rnams cha mnyam pa phye mar byas te kham phor kha sbyar du byas nas stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags pas lus la byugs te g-yul du zhugs na gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ka ru dang / pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar rnams cha mnyam pa phye mar byas te kham phor kha sbyar du byas nas stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags pas lus la byugs te g-yul du zhugs na gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having ground equal parts of aloe, priyaṅgu, and nāgakesara into powder, anoint one's body with it, having enchanted it one thousand and eight times, and enter into battle. One will be invincible by others.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited twenty-one hundred thousand times in front of Avalokiteśvara, one will become a vidyādhara.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gcig zlos shig /
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gcig zlos shig /
translated: Recite it eleven hundred thousand times.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal mthong ngo //
translated: One will see Noble Mañjuśrī.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bdun zlos shig /
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bdun zlos shig /
translated: In front of the painting, recite it seven hundred thousand times.

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become invisible.

original: nad kyis btab pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bco lnga zlos shig /
analyzed: nad kyis btab pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bco lnga zlos shig /
translated: For one who is afflicted with illness, in front of the painting, recite it one hundred and fifty thousand times.

original: nad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: nad 'joms par byed do //
translated: It will destroy the illness.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas 'bum phrag bcu gnyis zlos shig /
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas 'bum phrag bcu gnyis zlos shig /
translated: By one who has previously performed the rite, recite it twelve hundred thousand times.

original: bcud dam / bcud kyis len so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: bcud dam / bcud kyis len so sor rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain separately the elixir or the elixir of life.

original: de bros pas gnyer ma dang / skra dkar spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bros pas gnyer ma dang / skra dkar spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By running, one will abandon wrinkles and gray hair.

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live a long time, with the appearance of a sixteen-year-old.

original: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pas yungs kar rgyal po stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
analyzed: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pas yungs kar rgyal po stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg gyis shig /
translated: By reciting it three hundred thousand times, offer into the fire one thousand and eight mustard seeds.
